intro: Micractis, commonly known as the sea anemone, is a marine cnidarian belonging to the family Actiniidae. It is characterized by its soft, cylindrical body and a ring of tentacles surrounding its oral disc. The tentacles are used for capturing prey and defending against predators. Micractis species are typically found in shallow coastal waters, often attached to rocks or coral. Their vibrant colors and delicate appearance make them a notable component of marine ecosystems.
